content.description: <math alttext="G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins are a family of receptor proteins that are involved in transmitting signals from outside a cell to inside a cell. When a signaling molecule binds to a <math alttext="G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein, the <math alttext="G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein is activated. The <math alttext="G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein then activates an enzyme that produces a second messenger called <math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following describes a critical role of <math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> during the transduction stage of a <math alttext="G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein signal transduction pathway?

choices.label: <math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> carries the signal to the nucleus of the cell and results in new sequences of nucleotides being added to the cellâ€™s <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> binds the extracellular signal molecule and carries it to the intracellular target specified by the signal.

<math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> modifies a specific monomer so that it can be added to an elongating structural macromolecule.

<math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> results in the activation of an enzyme that amplifies the signal by acting on many substrate molecules.

content.answer: <math alttext="c A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cAMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> results in the activation of an enzyme that amplifies the signal by acting on many substrate molecules.
